resources.string:
§m§n code found. Choose how to use it:
1. Java: font style, Bedrock: color codes 2. Both: color codes
Java and Bedrock use color codes
Choose how to use §m (strikethrough) and §n (underline) codes:

Tellraw Command Generator helps you make tellraw commands.
It works for Java and Bedrock.

Selectors pick targets:
• @a - All players • @p - Nearest player • @r - Random player • @e - All entities • @s - Command sender
Use filters like: • @a[gamemode=survival] - All survival players • @e[type=cow] - All cows • @p[distance=..10] - Nearest player in 10 blocks

Use Minecraft color and format codes:
Colors: • §0 - Black §1 - Dark Blue §2 - Dark Green • §3 - Dark Aqua §4 - Dark Red §5 - Dark Purple • §6 - Gold §7 - Gray §8 - Dark Gray • §9 - Blue §a - Green §b - Aqua • §c - Red §d - Light Purple §e - Yellow • §f - White
Formats: • §l - Bold §m - Strike §n - Underline • §o - Italic §k - Random §r - Reset

Java and Bedrock use different selectors:
• Java: distance, Bedrock: r/rm • Java: gamemode, Bedrock: m • Java: nbt, Bedrock: hasitem
Text formats: • §m§n codes work differently • Some colors mean different things in Bedrock

1. Enter selector and message 2. App detects selector type 3. Generate Java and Bedrock commands 4. Copy or share commands
For §m§n codes: • Font style: Java keeps format, Bedrock uses colors • Color style: Both use colors
No folder (will save to app sandbox)

File "%s" already exists.

Do you want to use this file to append history?

If you choose "No", you need to customize a new file name.
Are you sure you want to clear storage settings?
History will be saved to app sandbox when no folder is selected
Java Edition uses font style, Bedrock Edition uses color code
Both Java and Bedrock Editions use color code mode
Command format incorrect, should be: tellraw <selector> <message>
Invalid selector, must be one of @a, @p, @r, @e or @s
Note: Java Edition does not support the following parameters, removed from Java command: %s
Note: Bedrock Edition does not support the following parameters, removed from Bedrock command: %s
Note: Bedrock selector %s is not supported in Java Edition, converted to %s
Bedrock selector %s is not supported in Java Edition, converted to %s
Bedrock scores negation parameter %s is not supported in Java Edition, removed
Java sort=nearest converted to Bedrock c=%s
Java sort=furthest converted to Bedrock c=%s
Java sort=arbitrary is not supported in Bedrock Edition, removed
Java sort=random converted to Bedrock c=%s
Java sort=%s is not supported in Bedrock Edition, removed
Java limit=%s parameter converted to Bedrock c=%s
limit is just a quantity limit, c is from near to far
Warning: Bedrock %s parameter is not supported in Java Edition, removed
Warning: Bedrock %s parameter has no equivalent function in Java Edition, removed
Warning: Bedrock %s parameter has no direct equivalent in Java Edition, removed. Consider using type parameter to specify entity type as an alternative
Warning: Java nbt parameter is not supported in Bedrock Edition, attempted to convert to hasitem parameter, if conversion failed then removed
Warning: Java %s parameter is not supported in Bedrock Edition, removed. Bedrock Edition has no direct equivalent for team system
Warning: Java %s parameter is not supported in Bedrock Edition, removed. Bedrock Edition has no predicate system
Warning: Java %s parameter is not supported in Bedrock Edition, removed. Bedrock Edition has no advancement system
Warning: Java %s parameter is not supported in Bedrock Edition, removed
Java distance=%s parameter converted to Bedrock rm=%s,r=%s
Java distance=%s parameter converted to Bedrock rm=%s
Java distance=%s parameter converted to Bedrock r=%s
Java distance=%s parameter converted to Bedrock rm=%s,r=%s
Java x_rotation=%s parameter converted to Bedrock rxm=%s,rx=%s
Java x_rotation=%s parameter converted to Bedrock rxm=%s
Java x_rotation=%s parameter converted to Bedrock rx=%s
Java x_rotation=%s parameter converted to Bedrock rxm=%s,rx=%s
Java y_rotation=%s parameter converted to Bedrock rym=%s,ry=%s
Java y_rotation=%s parameter converted to Bedrock rym=%s
Java y_rotation=%s parameter converted to Bedrock ry=%s
Java y_rotation=%s parameter converted to Bedrock rym=%s,ry=%s
Java level=%s parameter converted to Bedrock lm=%s,l=%s
Java level=%s parameter converted to Bedrock lm=%s
Java level=%s parameter converted to Bedrock l=%s
Java level=%s parameter converted to Bedrock lm=%s,l=%s
Java negation spectator mode (gamemode=!) is not supported in Bedrock Edition, converted to negation survival mode
Java spectator mode (gamemode=%s) is not supported in Bedrock Edition, converted to survival mode
Java gamemode=%s parameter converted to Bedrock m=%s
Bedrock rm=%s,r=%s parameter converted to Java distance=%s
Bedrock rm=%s parameter converted to Java distance=%s
Bedrock r=%s parameter converted to Java distance=%s
Java distance=%s parameter converted to Bedrock %s
Bedrock lm=%s,l=%s parameter converted to Java level=%s
Bedrock lm=%s parameter converted to Java level=%s
Bedrock l=%s parameter converted to Java level=%s
Java level=%s parameter converted to Bedrock %s
Bedrock negation default mode (m=!) is not supported in Java Edition, converted to negation survival mode
Bedrock default mode (m=%s) is not supported in Java Edition, converted to survival mode
Java level=%s parameter converted to Bedrock lm=%s,l=%s
Bedrock c=%s parameter converted to Java limit=%s,sort=furthest
Bedrock c=%s parameter converted to Java limit=%s,sort=nearest
hasitem parameter converted to nbt format, may not fully retain original meaning
Note: Java NBT does not require Count value, hasitem quantity parameter was not converted to NBT Count field
hasitem parameter conversion failed, keeping original hasitem parameter
nbt parameter converted to hasitem format, may not fully retain original meaning
